thread.title: Wayne Shaw breaks silence over pie-eating scandal and blames Arsenal fans | Metro News
thread.title_full: Wayne Shaw breaks silence over pie-eating scandal and blames Arsenal fans | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Wayne Shaw breaks silence over pie-eating scandal and blames Arsenal fans | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 10:00 am 
Former Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw claims he ate a pie on the bench because he was goaded by Arsenal fans. 
Shaw, who is nicknamed the ‘roly-poly goalie’ due to his 23-stone frame, was forced to resign on Tuesday after his antics during the FA Cup tie triggered an investigation from the Football Association and Gambling Commission . 
Before the match, Sun Bets offered odds of 8/1 on the 46-year-old eating a pie during the game, but FA rules prevent players from being involved in betting on a fixture, either directly or indirectly. 
‘The Arsenal fans were constantly singing about me, and shouting: ‘who ate all the pies?’’ Shaw told The Sun. 
‘There was a lot of banter, and I thought I could have a bit of fun here. I took a big bite and waved it in the air towards them, but it was all in good spirit. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
‘It didn’t cost me anything from the girl at the counter – apart from my job.’ 
Shaw insists that he and the Sutton United players did not make any money out of the stunt and admits he was caught up in the excitement of the match. 
‘There was no financial gain for myself or anyone I know, friends or family,’ he said. 
‘It was taken out of context, and it happened in the moment of the game. Shaw hoovered the dugout before the defeat to Arsenal. (Getty Images) Shaw is known as the ‘roly-poly goalie’ due to weighing 23 stone. (AMA/Getty Images) 
‘All the international stars there, it was overwhelming. I wasn’t paid to do it, I didn’t tell anyone I was going to do it. 
‘It wasn’t done for personal gain. Just something to remember, and it certainly is that now.
